website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot Elph 150 IS packs a long zoom lens into a small body, but its images have way too much noise.

customer_reviews.title: Good carry camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has met my expectations well. I carry the camera 24/7 in a belt holster. People who carry bulky cameras with multiple lenses usually do not carry their cameras randomly. Many of the best pictures are taken when you least expect it, and for the majority of picturesque situations, this camera will serve well. It is not particularly good in action pictures with limited lighting. I use this camera as a replacement for a smart phone. It has a very wide angle lens and its telephoto zoom is superior to the smart phone. This camera is probably fragile, especially the lens shutter assembly. I would treat it kindly, and it should take care of you likewise..
customer_reviews.author: tom75230

customer_reviews.title: ... and was hesitant to purchase but this is the best shoot and point that my husband has ever had
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews for this camera and was hesitant to purchase but this is the best shoot and point that my husband has ever had. The shutter speed is instant, the pictures are GREAT, and the camera is small enough for your pocket. If I could give this 10 stars I would!!! ** We aren't professional photographers, but professional photographs wouldn't be looking at a $129 camera. ha! This is great for vacations and just about anything else you might need it for. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: A gift for my wife.
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted a simple to use camera that she could take snapshots of the dogs with. I wanted her to have a good camera that had enough features that she could use it anytime she wanted, and that had a high enough pixel count that I could crop and edit her pictures. We both got what we wanted. This is a very nice little compact camera. It's small enough for her to stick in a pocket or her purse. It takes crisp, brilliantly colored pictures in a variety of situations I am very impressed with this little camera.
customer_reviews.author: K. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Nice, compact, great quality.little Canon.
customer_reviews.text: My old Canon PowerShot finally started malfunctioning, so I thought I'd buy a new one. This is an upgraded model with more zoom, etc. and yet nearly the same price I paid over 5 years ago! It is super clear, and love the video with the audio and video It was the best price I could find on the internet or brick and mortar stores. I bought a hard sided case separately and it really protects it when packed in luggage. Shipping was fast, arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Nice price for this great camera
customer_reviews.text: Small, easy to use, the optical zoom is useful and has a big range, takes great photos, nice vídeos with a high quality sound, if you want you will be able to use differents modes (like low light, panoramic, fireworks) or simply use Automatic mode... Don't need to be an expert By the other hand it needs a Flash-On setting, just have "Off" and "Auto" mode
customer_reviews.author: LJFO

customer_reviews.title: Very poor image quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very poor image quality. Don't get fooled by the mega-pixel data. Images have very bad artifacts, like a low res jpg, and nothing can be done about it. They even look bad when down res'd. I would NOT recommend this or buy this again. I ended up donating it to the Goodwill. The zoom range was nice, but that is the only "pro" I can think of.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Point and Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: An inexpensive point and shoot camera which replaces a dropped and inoperative Canon PowerShot ELPH SD-850 IS camera. This camera is smaller and "feels" inexpensively made. I personally like the mechanical selector switch and heavier feel of the previous camera. The 150 IS is smaller lighter and has a larger display screen. The camera features are available programmable, but not intuitive, so the use of the manual is a good idea for initial set-up of the camera.
customer_reviews.author: William V White

customer_reviews.title: Nice small point & shoot with 10x zoom and nice image quality
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace the small Canon ELPH my wife lost. She carries it in her purse for those situations where her cell phone camera just isn't up to snuff (e.g. high quality images, lighting challenges, zoom needed, etc). It's really nice and we both like the increased zoom capability (10x, her earlier ELPH only had a 5x optical zoom). One minor complaint is that they've moved some of the buttons around on the backside of the camera for no apparent functional reason (the picture review button is now the "?" button and the record button switched places with the "?" button).
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bechtel

customer_reviews.title: Love Canon and highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera as a gift for my daughter. It is her first real camera. We opened it and within a minute she was clicking away. She loves how easy it is to use and how it fits her small hands just right. We like that it came with a wrist strap so she can keep it safe while she's taking pictures. The picture quality is exceptional, especially for a beginner who doesn't always keep her hands still. We are extremely happy with our purchase and highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Yarbrough

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, 24mm wide-angle lens, 20megapixel camera, under $150.00, what else do you need ?
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wide 24mm P&S camera and has to be a Canon because of past good experiences with their cameras and under $150.00, so i found this little gem and it's been great. I needed a camera for those landscape/indoors shots which has a high megapixel sensor and this camera delivered. I'm a very happy owner.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Alegre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality in a Compact Size
customer_reviews.text: Excellent photos in a small size, easily carried in a pocket or purse. While not a substitute for a full size SLR with interchangeable lenses, this compact camera can fill in as the party camera, vacation camera or camera you just keep in the glove box for whatever. Good quality for smaller prints, great for any online use. This camera lasts pretty well on a battery charge and will take quite a few pictures on a 32 GB card, but it never hurts to have a spare battery and memory card handy.
customer_reviews.author: Hemlock

customer_reviews.title: A lot of camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Have used this camera for about a week and it's pretty nice. Chose the beautiful deep red. Understand that I am a novice and as such only gave it a 4 star rating due to my "out of the box" photos were a bit blurry. I'm sure as I learn more about this camera and it's settings my photo quality will improve. I could probably have bought something much more basic to suit my needs, but couldn't resist the great value for a 20 megapixel Canon.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! I got this to replace a 3 year old Elph 100 which I also liked. Used the camera during all my travels this year which included the Grand Canyon and the pictures came out great. Even was able to to get great shots of fireworks which I could never do with the old Elph. If you're looking for a lite compact camera that easily fits in you pocket and takes great pictures then you can't go wrong with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Major Shake

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace an older Cannon Powershot and I'm really pleased with it so far. Most of the time I'm using it to record videos, so the single button to start a video is a nice touch. The camera is also very light, so it is easy to hold for an extended period. For those times when you want something better than a cell phone and more convenient than a DSLR, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good camera at good price
customer_reviews.text: Good camera. Uses a different battery than our previous Canons which is too bad since we have spare chargers and batteries. But canon seems to be moving to a new battery on all their new PowerShots so what can you do. Takes good pics and is easy to use, and small. My wife doesn't like the fact that the view photos button is now higher up on the camera and her thumb hits it when she's trying to take a picture. Otherwise, it's a good camera at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Good for Photos.... not so much for wireless video transfer
customer_reviews.text: The camera came to me in really good condition but I was a little quick to hit the buy button because it didn't have the functions I was looking for. If you're looking for a good point and shoot camera, then you'll definitely be happy with this but if you want a camera to shoot video and you want to be able to wirelessly transfer your videos, then​ this one is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Ecc

customer_reviews.title: Tourists' best camera - purse size!
customer_reviews.text: Love my little digital camera. Slips into my purse, takes better zoom pics than my phone, and has great image stabilization (think tour bus). Also great in low light, like European cathedrals.
customer_reviews.author: GrassValleyMe

customer_reviews.title: ... it comes to camera operation but this camera is easy to use and the pictures are great
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert when it comes to camera operation but this camera is easy to use and the pictures are great. I am very satisfied. Have another Canon which influenced me to buy this one. It is smaller and fits in my shirt pocket. Great little camera and won't break the bank. Recommend to anyone who wants good pictures and doesn't want the fuss of all the bells and whistles of more expensive cameras.
customer_reviews.author: B. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Its an okay camera- its pretty horrible in capturing in action photos and you really ...
customer_reviews.text: Its an okay camera- its pretty horrible in capturing in action photos and you really have to keep the camera steady to get a good shot.I don't regret buying it- its a good price for a decent camera. Maybe I have to learn more about it- I loved my old canon camera but it was stolen :( it was actually an older version of this camera (less mega pixels and digital zoom) but for some reason I feel my old one was much better than this,
customer_reviews.author: Medina M.

customer_reviews.title: Durable but lackluster images
customer_reviews.text: This camera is "ok" for the price, but nothing to write home about. It suffers from really low light sensitivity which results in fuzzy images due to it jacking up the ISO. An iPhone 6 or the like takes far superior images to this. But this is fine if you are on the move and want something you do not have to worry about breaking. It has a tough housing that will take being tossed around without any real issues.
customer_reviews.author: B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I am so pleased and surprised at how beautifully my pictures came out
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent trip to Scotland and Ireland where the light was often minimal due to overcast. I am so pleased and surprised at how beautifully my pictures came out. Clearly my photos are not professional but they are very good. It is very easy to use for someone such as myself who is beyond technically challenged.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Okay...lacks cable
customer_reviews.text: The three stars are because this camera is just ok. It performs its basic functions adequately, and I really like the small size. It replaces an old, 4 megapixel version I got in 2003 or 2004. What surprises is me is that they can sell this camera without the USB cable to connect it to the computer. Luckily I have an SD card reader and the cable can be purchased for about $5 on Amazon, but it seems that, as a minimum, a company ought to include what really is a necessary cable to use the device.
customer_reviews.author: Rosetta

customer_reviews.title: Replaced older PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: Was purchased to replace an old Canon PowerShot that lost it's LCD display. This one has more features than I will use. I really like the 10x optical zoom and the more wide angle view. I also purchased an extra battery as well as a 16GB SD card. Cannon doesn't include SD cards anymore. Some of the other cameras by Canon and others probably would have been just as good, but this one had control features that were more familiar to me, i.e, buttons on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Lancelynx

customer_reviews.title: Having a Canon DSLR and using this as a easy point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Having a Canon DSLR and using this as a easy point and shoot camera, i rather enjoy it. It has all the bells and whistles as my DSLR does, however the high resolution images are still grainy or pixelated, which an be solved by resizing the images down. Otherwise it's a good camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey

customer_reviews.title: Image quality just okay. Handy and compact.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely designed and very compact so you can always have it with you and get better pictures than you would with a smartphone. If you want really good pictures with great image quality, however, this isn't the camera. Just not as sharp and detailed as I would like. Some of the features are pretty cool. The time lapse miniature effect movie feature is my favorite. Not a bad camera for $100. Not a great one either.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gladding

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice.
customer_reviews.text: Knowing very little about cameras, except to point and shoot, I depended on the reviews to help me choose one after my old camera died. The Canon Powershot ELPH 150 has been a good choice for me. I am still figuring out why it shuts down if I don't take the picture quick enough. With more direction reading and picture taking I am sure this problem will be resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Doro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I loved having this small camera for my family's first trip to Disneyland. I did not want to drag around my larger camera everyday and wanted something I could use conveniently. This camera worked great. I would recommend if you want clear shots and fast timing to get a fast SD card though.
customer_reviews.author: Killswitch

customer_reviews.title: Nice little point and shoot...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera for a point and shoot. BE AWARE: There are no instructions for its use. In theory it can do all sorts of things, but with no instruction manual, it's trial and error. Yes, there is a menu built into the camera, but I like to be able to have a hard copy in front of me while learning a new device. And this didn't have one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sagor

customer_reviews.title: and it's a much better camera. I've got to get used to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I had an older canon ELPH, and lost it. Bought this as a replacement, and it's a much better camera. I've got to get used to the travelling focal point. It'll try to focus on a point other than the subject at times. great point and shoot camera though.
customer_reviews.author: Fuel683

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!!
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Good buy . Sells for $149 at Best Buy. Easy to use. We bought it for my 6yr old nephew. He's a brainiac! He loves taking pictures, creating movies and youtube videos. This is not a toy. However, it was perfect for him. I have a similar camera I use for vacations when I don't want to risk losing or getting my more expensive camera stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Janh

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera For Cheap
customer_reviews.text: First off this I never had a problem with Canons Power shot cameras .this camera surprised me on how close you can take pictures . I took a picture of my TV up close and i can see the individual red blue green blocks. It also has incredible zoom for distance . In all this camera is great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It does OK.
customer_reviews.text: This Elph was not as good as the one it replaced that was 10 years old. It is not as well made and I don't expect it to last as long. It takes pretty good pictures, but I almost always have to brighten them with an editor.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: I am DELIGHTFULLY surprised at how much I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I am DELIGHTFULLY surprised at how much I love this camera! It is small and light-weight yet takes really sharp, clear photos. It also is very user-friendly with my computer so photos are easy to upload and adjust. Great camera at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Delahanty

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift. Worked perfectly for about 3 months. Then the dreaded gray screen. We haven't figured out what happened. We have used this line of cameras exclusively for over 10 years. Went back to the earlier version, albeit with a sensitive battery/sd card compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Thyme

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for my husband who takes a lot of close shots of items he resells. He LOVES it! Close ups are very clear and the zoom is wonderful. Can't say enough positive things about this little camera. And it fits into his pocket when traveling.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: Good for amateur photographers
customer_reviews.text: size is great and easy to slip in pocket and takes nice photos-find the zoom lever awkward and hard to manipulate-other than that perfect for what I wanted to use it for
customer_reviews.author: Frances J. Dickerman

customer_reviews.title: Camera is nice and takes good quality pictures
customer_reviews.text: Camera is nice and takes good quality pictures. The flash isn't the best and not great for taking rapid fire pictures as it likes to adjust focus for each shot.
customer_reviews.author: Shockhammer3

customer_reviews.title: Great clear photos. Perfect little camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Perfect for hiking or anything where you don't want to run down your phones battery taking photos.
customer_reviews.author: Robert BlankTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: ... had Canon cameras for their long battery life and good quality photos
customer_reviews.text: I always had Canon cameras for their long battery life and good quality photos. This model in particular I found the shutter delay to slow to take fast action photos. Also the flash is way to bright making good photos in the dark hard to take.
customer_reviews.author: ThePaperCrown

customer_reviews.title: This is such an easy to use camera that fits in my purse or ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such an easy to use camera that fits in my purse or pocket. This is the third Canon Power Shot that I have owned. Just love the powerful zoom. This post is listed under my husband's name, but I bought the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Will D.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have had a few ELPHS. They are user friendly. If I would stop dropping or losing them my life would be simpler and cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Samanera Ken

customer_reviews.title: Good average camera
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this camera too long since I dropped it and the preview screen got a big crack. But for the time we got to use it, I think the quality of the pictures is all right.
customer_reviews.author: A. Grigorova

customer_reviews.title: Nice little camera. 10x optical is nice, just don't get carried away with the 4x digital...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera. 10x optical is nice, just don't get carried away with the 4x digital, it can pixilate if you're not careful. I haven't shot a lot of pic yet but I like what I am seeing. Need to go on a few more foto trips and really try it out.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This camera has been great for taking places I don't want to take my ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera has been great for taking places I don't want to take my big camera. Great zoom and clarity. I've been really impressed with the photos from such a tiny camera.
customer_reviews.author: laurissa

customer_reviews.title: Red Streaking. Waiting for refund.
customer_reviews.text: When filming or taking photos it had horrible red streaking on the images across the entire length of the screen even after being uploaded. Definitely not cool. Going to keep checking when I will receive my refund after sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Channy Chan

customer_reviews.title: Greatest little camera
customer_reviews.text: Greatest little camera. Takes wonderful pictures, love the zoom, and it fits in my purse so nicely. Wonderful for traveling when nice pictures are in the plan.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda K

customer_reviews.title: Reconditioned camera works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Takes excellent pictures and fits neatly in my jacket pocket
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Watten

customer_reviews.title: My phone takes better pictures....
customer_reviews.text: My phone takes better pictures than this camera ever will.....sorry 1 star I wasted my money with this one...
customer_reviews.author: Linda Erutero

customer_reviews.title: great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera for what its worth. I got it for my wife for Christmas and we have been using it for every occasion with ease. its easy to use and the picture comes out clear. it has a pretty good battery life I've never had a problem with it dying on me during a trip. just as long as you charge it before you go then you should be fine for a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathanjules

customer_reviews.title: OK, but was hoping for more
customer_reviews.text: Missing the viewfinder---but could not find one in this price-range that had one. Quality is OK but I am used to a viewfinder. Very long delay between hitting shutter button and actual photo taken----really only good for still shots.
customer_reviews.author: BTL

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous camera for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive and very easy to use shoot and point camera. It takes great shots. I highly recommend it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Rigaux-O'Shea

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted: compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this camera, though I am a little slow in mastering its capabilities. I was disappointed that it did not come with a memory card, but was able to remedy that locally. The descriptive information should have made that clear. It did come with a charger.
customer_reviews.author: Gramma B

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera, great battery life, and photo quality.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this camera for several months, and so far, no complaints. Battery life is good, and pictures are very good quality. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for it's compactness ..more features than I will ever know how to use at age 70!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera series - alas
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera series - alas, if programmed manually as opposed to auto, all the details fill the shooting screen border, which is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: marie victoria reaser

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Takes great pictures at a portable size
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Takes great pictures at a portable size. I love being out door, hiking, boating, jet skis, four wheeling, etc and this camera is great for travel. I can slip it in my pocket and go go go and get awesome pics too. :)
customer_reviews.author: AshleyNichole

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for the price. Takes good pictures. Would not recommend for professional use . Just got it for my baby bag.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Wells

customer_reviews.title: ... to my camera but the quality of pictures is great. Easy to carry on me and the kit ...
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to my camera but the quality of pictures is great. Easy to carry on me and the kit you sold me as an add on has a real nice camera case.
customer_reviews.author: Ed E

customer_reviews.title: ELPH 150 CAMERA DOES NOT OPEN PROPERLY
customer_reviews.text: This camera worked fine for a while, however I'm having a problem now. When clicking the camera ON, the guard over the lens does not fan open. I have to maneuver it open with my fingernail to separate the parts. Only then can I use it. When pressing the camera OFF, It will fan closed O K. After a while it may open once or twice as it should, but then again it has to be maneuvered open again with my fingernail.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D'Orazio

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: For being a 20mp camera, I didn't notice much of a difference between this and my other 14mp point and shoot camera. It's nice and you can easily use everything...just not the upgrade I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: M. Keifer

customer_reviews.title: lives up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera for a point and shoot. I like the ease of use, compactness and picture quality is what I expect from a camera at this price point and it is a Canon so quality is there
customer_reviews.author: nastystang

customer_reviews.title: Nice Simple No-fuss Camera.
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be just what I was looking for. A camera small enough to tuck into my handbag while traveling so I don't have to keep track of yet another thing. The focusing is as good as my more complicated Nikon and the date and time were easily set up. No complications. The battery charged very quickly. I'm looking forward to using it on a trip.
customer_reviews.author: MPS

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the picture quality of this camera. My Canon SD780IS lasted for many years and finally died on me. I chose this camera as a replacement due to the great reviews here on Amazon. The price sounded too good to be true based on how well the reviews stated the photo quality was. Well, it was too good to be true. If you normally buy the bottom-of-the-barrel camera for under $100, then this might be a good camera, but if you normally use higher quality cameras, then I would recommend skipping this camera. PROS : small, light, good zoom CONS : basic features and only "okay" quality pictures
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My husband really likes these Canon ELPH cameras. He wants it as simple as possible and small enough for his pocket. He preferred the SD 1000 that he has been using for years, but it stopped working. This works mostly the same, takes good pictures and is easy to use. I felt the quality of the case ie the battery / sd card cover is reduced. It is slightly bigger than the older version but does have a larger viewing screen. Overall, it is a good choice for a small, no brainer camera.
customer_reviews.author: MerMac

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: A great camera for the money. Easy to use but it would be better if it contained an operators manual.
customer_reviews.author: Don Nugent

customer_reviews.title: It works great. It is easy for anyone to use
customer_reviews.text: It works great. It is easy for anyone to use, and we like the separated button for video. My 1.5 year son likes dancing so every time when he does, I can take a video with this camera immediately. It helps to keep a good memory.
customer_reviews.author: Yoshinori Nito

customer_reviews.title: There was a lot of movement when the pics were taken but I have used other point and shoot cameras in the same price range in th
customer_reviews.text: I only have taken a few pictures indoors and in a very well lit area and some shots seem a bit blurry to me. There was a lot of movement when the pics were taken but I have used other point and shoot cameras in the same price range in the same setting and did not notice the blurring like this. Maybe I need a little practice with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ward

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera.  Easy to use and great pics.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Takes amazing pictures and has been very reliable. We only use the standard settings, but there are lots of options. I would recommend the camera....even if your kids are the ones taking the pics.
customer_reviews.author: LKTAR

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Point and Shoot Camera - Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Really like the Cannon point and shoot camera ... this is my 4th one / great pictures (now includes short video options too) and very ez to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for a relatively cheap camera. Easy to use; sharp clear photos. Like all cameras with a display only (vs. display + viewfinder), sometimes difficult to frame your photo when using in bright sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Revret

customer_reviews.title: Canon power shot ELPH 150 ISDigital
customer_reviews.text: Not as happy with this camera as my old Kodak. Picture is clear but dos not have things I can do with picture like crop it
customer_reviews.author: sophie

customer_reviews.title: Great photos! Easy to store in my purse
customer_reviews.text: Great photos ! Easy to store in my purse. Great zoom in !
customer_reviews.author: CaCooper

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and store. Auto focus feature is great, even got shots from a fast moving train.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy to use. Clarity is great. I gave one toy daughter for a recent trip and they loved it too.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great Little Camera, I had coolpix which is nice,but over all this is a Much better Camera,I ended buying another 1 for Work
customer_reviews.author: michael may

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera for a cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera for a cheap price. It does what I need it to do, and the picture quality is better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina Reinert

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are good. Clear pics and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are good. Clear pics and easy to handle. Still learning use but seems good for the average interest in cameras person. Four stars as changing modes isn't clear.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen B.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this cute little camera & I've owned several Canons
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this cute little camera & I've owned several Canons, but they keep adding features & I love the wide-angle on this one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Johnsen

customer_reviews.title: Lag time too long
customer_reviews.text: This takes nice photso, but the lag time between pressing the shutter release and the photo taking is LONG. The size is nice to slip in a pocket or a purse.
customer_reviews.author: Chele

customer_reviews.title: this is NOT one of their better ones.
customer_reviews.text: Not real impressed with this camera....part of the selling point was its a "canon" have had Canons on the past an they are quality,this is NOT one of their better ones....you get what you pay for tho
customer_reviews.author: americanorway

customer_reviews.title: Good for all types of photography
customer_reviews.text: Lots of nice features but also easy to use. Photos and video have very good quality to them. The image stabilization works really good too.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect camera for young teen
customer_reviews.text: Perfect camera for young teen. Takes decent pictures and videos for fun use. Nice bold Cobalt blue color. Consistent with Canon quality. Affordable, simple camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sunmaid

customer_reviews.title: Bought two of these.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second camera like this we have bought. The first one was for us and we liked it so much we bought one for our son.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine L.

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: great camera. takes excellent photos. small and light weight yet has a nice zoom. perfect for outings on the quad or rzr, hiking ect. I use a 90 mps 600x 32gb card. I can take as good a picture with this as my DSLR. Has some similar functions.
customer_reviews.author: ace

customer_reviews.title: You can never go wrong with a Canon ELPH!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has owned other Canon ELPHs and LOVES them. She never goes anywhere without one. They're convenient and offer almost as much as her larger Rebel.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great camera as a point and shoot. Great price worth the value.
customer_reviews.author: William S. White

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: very happy with my camera. has a nice weight to it, pictures come out clear, not very many effects or ability to play with aperture or lighting but it delivers :)
customer_reviews.author: K. Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Good simple camera
customer_reviews.text: I brought this camera for my mother for Mother's Day. She likes the camera it takes good pictures. The only thing was we couldn't figure out how to zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Chelli

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, nice pictures
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, nice pictures, easy to use, wish I had bought a case or wish maybe a case came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amaka

customer_reviews.title: Cannon camera review
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great camera. Canon quality gives me less to worry about.

customer_reviews.title: and takes great pictures. Could not be happier with this
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, compact, and takes great pictures. Could not be happier with this camera
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot 150
customer_reviews.text: Meets my expectations. About the size of my iPhone, the 150 is a better camera than any phone camera.
customer_reviews.author: James Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: I wanted an easy camera and this is good in a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an easy camera and this is good in a lot of ways but too many bells and whistles for me. I am tech challenged!
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price Fast shipping Well built Worked well as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Reasonable price Fast shipping Well built Worked well as advertised

customer_reviews.title: Good little pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: Good little pocket camera, only negative is there is no way to turn on a flash, it's auto or no flash.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Goes a nice job for a simple point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: D. J.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect for a senior citizen which I am - simple and puts out a good picture
customer_reviews.author: Mary Mayfield

customer_reviews.title: Great, sturdy little point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy little point and shoot camera. No complaints and the picture quality is quite good.
customer_reviews.author: BreAn

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less than one year!!!! Would not buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: perfect size, bought to fit in small purse on my upcoming vacation. Takes good pictures

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 150 IS Digital Camera (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueKit Includes PowerShot ELPH 150, Wrist Strap WS-800, Battery Pack NB-11LH, Battery Charger CB-2LF, Leaflet Getting Started, Printer Promotion Flyer, Warranty Card, Promotional Tag, Packing. USB Cable, Video Cable, SD Card and Solutions Disk Not Included.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

SPECTACULAR IMAGING THAT'S STYLISH
Some events are just too important to trust to the image quality of a smartphone camera. For those times, slip the ultra-slim, brilliantly stylish PowerShot ELPH 150 IS camera in your pocket. With the 10x Optical Zoom, you can reach right into the action to frame a shot just the way you want it, without blur or loss of resolution. The camera's 20.0 Megapixel sensor captures even the smallest details with superb clarity, naturally vivid color and beautiful luminosity. When you enlarge and print frame-worthy moments from weddings, important celebrations, vacations and more, the result is truly impressive: images that not only preserve your memories, but render them with all the lifelike, emotive nuance of great photography. For all its sophisticated imaging capabilities, the PowerShot ELPH 150 IS camera is extremely easy to use. Smart AUTO ensures you'll always get the best shot by automatically selecting the perfect camera settings for 32 shooting situations, so you can focus on capturing the moment. And Intelligent IS keeps photos and videos clear and steady, controlling camera shake even at the long end of the zoom.

SPECTACULAR LENS POWER FOR STUNNING IMAGES
10X OPTICAL ZOOM
The PowerShot ELPH 150 IS features a 10x Optical Zoom so spectacular shots are within your reach. You'll love the flexibility it gives you when shooting with an amazing range of 24–240mm (35mm equivalent) in a slim, stylish compact camera. Plus, the Wide-Angle lens captures expansive image in every shot, adding depth, perspective and grandeur. Landscapes, city scenes, family shots and more benefit from the extra width. Whether you're shooting wide group shots or zooming to the telephoto end, your images are assured to be bright and clear.

BEAUTIFUL IMAGES AND INCREDIBLE PERFORMANCE START HERE
20.0 MEGAPIXEL SENSOR
Preserve all those special moments from weddings to vacations in stunning quality with the PowerShot ELPH 150 IS. The camera is equipped with a newly developed 20.0 Megapixel sensor to ensure that images are incredibly clear and beautifully detailed. The high level of resolution gives you the flexibility to be more creative with your shots: crop and enlarge any part of an image – you can be confident that the detail and resolution you need are there, even when you want to print and frame your photos.


DIGIC 4+ IMAGE PROCESSOR
The PowerShot ELPH 150 IS camera's DIGIC 4+ Image Processor features accelerated processing speed to create fast, responsive performance, giving you a shooting experience that's easy and natural. The DIGIC 4+ Image Processor also enhances image quality in several ways. Processing of high ISO shots has been shortened by 60% compared to the DIGIC 4 Image Processor. This significantly reduces noise for brilliant color, smooth gradations, and beautiful detail even in low light. The processor also allows for the integration of electronic Dynamic IS. This advanced system compensates for multiple motion types, effectively preventing angular blur, shift blur, and blur caused by parallel movement and tilt shift. The result is images that are reliably sharp and clear at all lengths of the camera's powerful 10x zoom. The processor's highly efficient design also extends battery life. 

GORGEOUS HD VIDEO FROM YOUR STILL CAMERA
720P HD VIDEO
Using the slim PowerShot ELPH 150 IS, you can shoot high definition video anytime, anywhere. With a simple push of the dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record every moment in motion. 720p HD video is smooth, vivid, and beautifully lifelike, making it an ideal way to capture special memories. 

A SMARTER CAMERA MEANS BETTER PHOTOS AND VIDEOS
SMART AUTO
Getting that great shot is as simple as pressing the shutter button on the PowerShot ELPH 150 IS camera with Smart AUTO, which automatically detects scenes by assessing various factors in both the background and the subject. On the PowerShot ELPH 150 IS, detected scenes are analyzed using 32 predefined shooting situations. The camera then makes optimal settings to ensure the best possible image capture, whether you're shooting stills or video. Smart AUTO also includes Advanced Subject Detection, which allows the camera to detect and track non-human moving subjects like animals and vehicles. With Smart AUTO, all you have to do is frame your shot and capture away.

SHOOTING MODES
Smart AUTO The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity. Program The camera automatically and intelligently selects the aperture/shutter speed combination based on the shooting conditions. Live View Control Enables Brightness, Color, and Tone adjustments to your images using easy-to-understand controls. Portrait Brings the subject into focus while beautifully blurring the background. Low Light For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly lit situations. Fisheye Effect Now you can get the fisheye effect – a classic photographic distortion – without a fisheye lens. Miniature Effect Give images a miniature look with an effect that emphasizes perspective by blurring the top and bottom of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint. Fireworks Create brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Long Shutter Use to blur moving subjects for artistic effect, ideal for urban night photography. Movie Record video; unwanted scenes can be deleted in playback mode. Actual results may vary from examples shown above.
Final image may vary depending on picture composition.

A STEADY IMAGE IS A BEAUTIFUL IMAGE
INTELLIGENT IS
It's easy to capture clear, steady images with the PowerShot ELPH 150 IS, even in low light without using a tripod. That's because the camera is equipped with Canon's innovative Intelligent IS. The system automatically analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation – allowing you to focus on framing and capturing your shot. For stills, the system selects from Normal IS, Panning IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and Tripod modes. When shooting video, the system selects from Dynamic IS, Powered IS, Macro (Hybrid) IS and active Tripod IS modes. New icons clearly mark the image stabilization mode, whether you're shooting still images or video.

Still Image Shooting Normal IS Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning IS Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Tripod When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. Video Recording Dynamic IS Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered IS Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Macro (Hybrid) IS Corrects for motion blur that is likely to occur when shooting video while walking. Also compensates for the shift-type camera shake common in macro shooting. Active Tripod IS When shooting video while using a tripod, the image stabilization is active to compensate for slight camera shake. MORE WAYS TO GET CREATIVE
CREATIVE SHOOTING MODES
The PowerShot ELPH 150 IS provides shooting modes that easily give your shots a distinctly artistic feel without the need for any extra lenses and filters. Super Vivid heightens and saturates colors for eye-popping intensity. Poster Effect eliminates gradations between colors for an illustrative feel. Miniature Effect enhances perspective in a scene, blurring the top and bottom to make it look as if it were created with miniature models. You can also make a quirky portrait using the Fisheye Effect or add a beautiful single-tone effect with Monochrome. Toy Camera Effect simulates a vintage look as if capturing the photo using a "toy" or pinhole camera.

A CHARGE THAT LASTS AS LONG AS A MEMORY
ECO MODE
The PowerShot ELPH 150 IS features ECO Mode to provide more shots per single charge through LCD monitor and camera power management. The mode can be activated via a dedicated button for easy power preservation when an outlet is unavailable or the moment is too exciting to put the camera down. ECO Mode quickly wakes the camera from sleep when a button is pressed so you won't miss the moment. When the fun with family and friends runs late into the evening, ECO Mode makes sure your camera keeps up.

HELP YOU WON'T NEED HELP TO FIND
HELP BUTTON
The PowerShot ELPH 150 IS camera is designed to be fun and easy to use, even for beginners. A Help Button on the camera's exterior brings up the help menu any time you need it, right on the LCD screen. From here, you can scroll through a variety of topics that answer your questions with clear explanations, offer helpful shooting advice, and show you diagrams highlighting the position of any buttons you'll need.
feature_bullets: 20.0 Megapixel sensor combined with the DIGIC 4+ Image Processor for outstanding performance.
10x Optical Zoom helps ensure outstanding optical performance and versatility.
Shoot 720p HD video with a dedicated movie button.
Smart AUTO intelligently selects the proper camera settings based on 32 predefined shooting situations.
Scene Modes such as Fisheye Effect, Toy Camera Effect and Monochrome provide creative freedom to capture your photos.
